SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_000_CUT_000_00.speaker: Cathedral_Officer
SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_000_CUT_000_00.text:
Right then. Last name Mido, first name...
Huh. Never seen this one before.
How is it pronounced?

SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_000_CUT_000_03.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_000_CUT_000_03.text:
Tsunanori. And I'd appreciate
it if you don't forget it, okay?

SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_000_CUT_000_04.speaker: Cathedral_Officer
SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_000_CUT_000_04.text: Oh, Tsunanori! Of course that's what it is! Very sorry about that. It's an awful thing to get a person's name wrong.

SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_000_CUT_000_05.speaker: Cathedral_Officer
SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_000_CUT_000_05.text:
Yeesh! People in this country are always
so uptight about their precious names...

SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_000_CUT_000_06.speaker: Cathedral_Officer
SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_000_CUT_000_06.text:
Well then! Tsunanori Mido, you have been
chosen to participate in the Cathedral Project.
Your presence here today is considered an
indication of your willingness to cooperate.
I trust you have no objections?

SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_000_CUT_000_07.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_000_CUT_000_07.text:
Heck, this isn't the kind of thing a guy's
really allowed to refuse. Figured it'd be
easier if I just marched in like I wanted
to be here in the first place.

SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_000_CUT_000_08.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_000_CUT_000_08.text:
So no, yeah... I'd be happy to chip in
with this Cathedral Project of yours.

SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_000_CUT_000_09.speaker: Cathedral_Officer
SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_000_CUT_000_09.text: Very good. To assist you in your mission, you will be provided four kugutsu puppets— Wait, four!? That can't be right. Er, but the paperwork all seems to be in order, so...

SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_000_CUT_000_10.speaker: Cathedral_Officer
SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_000_CUT_000_10.text:
Tsunanori Mido... Miiido...
Is your father Tadamichi Mido,
the Vice-Minister of Domestic Affairs?

SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_000_CUT_000_12.speaker: Cathedral_Officer
SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_000_CUT_000_12.text: I see. Okay, what's going on here? There's no way this kid can make use of FOUR kugutsu... Ugh. Why did I have to get such a weird case on my first day on the job?

SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_000_CUT_000_14.speaker: Cathedral_Officer
SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_000_CUT_000_14.text:
No, everything is perfectly all right.
Now please collect your equipment and
head inside. The rest is up to you.

SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_100_CUT_000_02.speaker: Cathedral_Officer
SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_100_CUT_000_02.text:
Congratulations! You have been chosen
to participate in the Cathedral Project.

SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_100_CUT_000_03.speaker: Cathedral_Officer
SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_100_CUT_000_03.text: But I suppose I don't need to explain any of that to you, seeing as you're the nephew of Tadamichi Mido, Vice-Minister of Domestic Affairs.

SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_100_CUT_000_04.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_100_CUT_000_04.text:
Now hold on just a second there.
My uncle might work for the government,
but that doesn't mean I know anything
about your fancy project. What is it?

SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_100_CUT_000_05.speaker: Cathedral_Officer
SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_100_CUT_000_05.text: Stop pretending—it demeans us both. Just take the four kugutsu puppets already.

SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_100_CUT_000_06.speaker: Cathedral_Officer
SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_100_CUT_000_06.text: Can't believe you have four. I got a chance to handle one of those things during training, and it just ran around doing its own thing. How am I supposed to deal with that, huh?

SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_100_CUT_000_07.speaker: Cathedral_Officer
SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_100_CUT_000_07.text:
Anyway, what exactly is Vice-Minister
Mido trying to get you to do?

SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_100_CUT_000_08.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_100_CUT_000_08.text:
Well, during the old regime, the Mido family
churned out a whole buncha ministers.
Some even got written up in textbooks
and such, as I'm sure you know.

SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_100_CUT_000_09.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_100_CUT_000_09.text:
But what the books don't say is that our
real family profession involves manipulatin'
kugutsu, and that we made our bones in the
world by using 'em for all sorts of jobs.

SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_100_CUT_000_10.speaker: Cathedral_Officer
SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_100_CUT_000_10.text:
...Did you really think I'd buy a ridiculous explanation
like that? Save the fantasy stuff for comic books and
video games. Anyway, I'll be sure to spend some time
looking into all of that later.

SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_100_CUT_000_11.speaker: Cathedral_Officer
SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_100_CUT_000_11.text:
Now please collect your equipment and
head inside. The rest is up to you.

SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_200_CUT_000_00.speaker: Cathedral_Officer
SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_200_CUT_000_00.text:
You're Tsunanori Mido, yes?
Here to participate in the Cathedral Project?

SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_200_CUT_000_02.speaker: Cathedral_Officer
SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_200_CUT_000_02.text:
I've been assigned here from the executive office of the president
of the Union States, on the direct orders of Tadamichi Mido,
Vice-Minister of Domestic Affairs. Nothing about the Cathedral Project
is meant to be concealed from the Union States. The opposite, in fact—
we're here to do all we can to prove its value.

SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_200_CUT_000_03.speaker: Cathedral_Officer
SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_200_CUT_000_03.text:
There may be nothing secretive about the project,
but it seems you, on the other hand, may be keeping
some secrets of your own, Tsunanori Mido.

SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_200_CUT_000_04.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_200_CUT_000_04.text:
Not this guy. I'm just your average university student
with nothing to hide. I mean, heck, maybe there's
a thing or three I'd like to keep close to the vest,
but I bet you've got a few of those yourself, eh?

SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_200_CUT_000_05.speaker: Cathedral_Officer
SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_200_CUT_000_05.text:
I'm sure you're aware that the Mido family
has always been of particular interest to the
Union States, which is why its most important
figures are kept under very careful watch.

SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_200_CUT_000_06.speaker: Cathedral_Officer
SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_200_CUT_000_06.text: But you? You're different. There's literally no information about you on file anywhere. How is it possible that it took me coming all the way to this country just to learn that you even exist?

SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_200_CUT_000_07.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_200_CUT_000_07.text: Makes sense to me. I was born in Miyako City twenty years ago and never lived anywhere else. Heck, I'd be more worried if you Union States fellas did know all my information.

SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_200_CUT_000_08.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_200_CUT_000_08.text:
Now let's get this show on the road, eh?
Didja bring me here to help out with the
Cathedral Project, or are you just gonna
keep pokin' around my business?

SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_200_CUT_000_09.speaker: Cathedral_Officer
SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_200_CUT_000_09.text:
Apologies—I let my personal curiosity get the better of me there.
Your job is to pass through Ama-no-Iwato Cave and venture into 
the Heavens beyond to gather whatever information you can find.
Once that's done, come back and share your findings with us.
That's it.

SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_200_CUT_000_10.speaker: Cathedral_Officer
SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_200_CUT_000_10.text:
I examined that big stone myself, by the way. I'm told it leads
somewhere, but it seems like a normal rock. And when I looked
at the other side, it was just...the other side of a big rock.
Pretty hard to believe it connects to the Heavens, but there you go.

SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_200_CUT_000_11.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_200_CUT_000_11.text:
Well now, I thought everybody in the Union
States believed in the land of the gods.
You mean to say that's not the case?

SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_200_CUT_000_12.speaker: Cathedral_Officer
SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_200_CUT_000_12.text: The only thing I know for certain is that the land of my gods is not waiting on the other side of that rock.

SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_200_CUT_000_13.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_200_CUT_000_13.text:
Welp, as long as we're shooting straight here,
I don't think there's anything on the other
side of Ama-no-Iwato Cave, either.

SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_200_CUT_000_14.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_200_CUT_000_14.text:
But I'm a Mido. It's my responsibility
to do what I can, so that there is
exactly what I'm gonna do.

SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_300_CUT_000_09.speaker: Cathedral_Officer
SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_300_CUT_000_09.text: Right then. You'll be provided with four kugutsu puppets to assist you. Also, surprise! Someone from the Mido family gets special treatment right off the bat. What a shocker.

SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_300_CUT_000_10.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_300_CUT_000_10.text: Can't say I much appreciate the snark there. I mean, manipulating kugutsu is our family trade, you know?

SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_300_CUT_000_11.speaker: Cathedral_Officer
SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_300_CUT_000_11.text: The Cathedral Project is an official government undertaking funded with money from the national budget, not some lark to support your family's private business. You do get that, right?

SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_300_CUT_000_12.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_300_CUT_000_12.text:
No, yeah, I getcha. You need me to head into the worlds
on the other side of the stone gate, gather information,
then bring it back so you can create a better future for
the nation. That about sum it up there?

SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_300_CUT_000_13.speaker: Cathedral_Officer
SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_300_CUT_000_13.text:
Um... Yes, actually. In fact, you just recited the outline
I wrote for you nearly word-for-word. But while that's
impressive, I need to know more—starting with the
Mido family's ultimate goal in all of this.

SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_300_CUT_000_14.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_300_CUT_000_14.text:
Sounds more like a question for my uncle there.
I'm just a plain old university student—reading
stuff and reciting it back is about all I'm good for.

SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_300_CUT_000_15.speaker: Cathedral_Officer
SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_300_CUT_000_15.text:
Very well, have it your way;
I'm certain I'll get the answers
I'm looking for when you return.
In any case, good luck out there.

SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_000_CUT_010_00.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_000_CUT_010_00.text: So this is the Ama-no-Iwato, huh?

SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_000_CUT_010_01.speaker: Cathedral_Officer
SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_000_CUT_010_01.text:
It is indeed. Fun fact: most people chosen
for the Project end up going home without
even managing to get it open. Let's hope
you put on a better show than that.

SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_000_CUT_010_02.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_000_CUT_010_02.text:
So what's the deal here? This the kinda
thing where I gotta recite a spell or
solve a riddle or something, or do I just
muscle it out of the way like in the myths?

SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_000_CUT_010_03.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_000_CUT_010_03.text:
...So this really is the path
I'm meant to walk, huh?

SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_200_CUT_010_00.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_200_CUT_010_00.text:
Boy howdy, things sure have changed...
Both the Ama-no-Iwato and the shrine used
to be great places for the kiddos to play,
but not even grown-ups can get close now.

SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_200_CUT_010_01.speaker: Cathedral_Officer
SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_200_CUT_010_01.text:
I very much look forward to seeing how
you plan to move that massive gate.

SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_200_CUT_010_02.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_200_CUT_010_02.text: That makes two of us. I got no heckin' clue what I'm supposed to do here... although I do get the feeling the path I'm meant to walk lies ahead.

SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_200_CUT_010_03.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_200_CUT_010_03.text:
O great stone gate...
Please show me the way.

SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_300_CUT_010_00.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_300_CUT_010_00.text:
I definitely get the feeling my
future's waitin' for me on the
other side of this stone...

SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_300_CUT_010_02.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_300_CUT_010_02.text:
Also, can't say I'm sure if the gods
are gonna be okay with some human
opening up a path to the Heavens...

SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_300_CUT_010_03.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_300_CUT_010_03.text: Welp! Guess that's up to the stone.

SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_RETURN_000_CUT_000_010.speaker: Cathedral_Officer
SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_RETURN_000_CUT_000_010.text:
Wait, what? Oh, come oooooon!
I can't believe you screwed it up!

SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_RETURN_000_CUT_000_020.speaker: Cathedral_Officer
SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_RETURN_000_CUT_000_020.text: The second you disappeared, I was here thinking how lucky I was to have my first time on the job be a rousing success, but that was clearly premature. I mean, you came back really fast.

SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_RETURN_000_CUT_000_030.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_RETURN_000_CUT_000_030.text: Sorry about that. Guess I'm not made of the right stuff for this kind of thing. Also, I am seriously tuckered out. So, uh... What do I do now?

SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_RETURN_000_CUT_000_040.speaker: Cathedral_Officer
SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_RETURN_000_CUT_000_040.text:
Feel free to head home. We might call you
back for a medical check at some point,
so be prepared to come in for that.

SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_RETURN_000_CUT_000_050.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_RETURN_000_CUT_000_050.text: You betcha. See you around, then.

SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_RETURN_000_CUT_010_000.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_RETURN_000_CUT_010_000.text:
So did time just kind of stop over here,
or was that whole thing some kind of
wild daydream?

SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_RETURN_000_CUT_010_010.speaker: Komachi_Kugutu
SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_RETURN_000_CUT_010_010.text:
We house the power of the spirits within us.
It can be stated unequivocally that what we
experienced was neither dream, nor illusion.

SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_RETURN_000_CUT_010_020.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_RETURN_000_CUT_010_020.text: Well, heck. That's a piece of good news. But wait, if things were frozen over here, does that mean I...gained time? Or does it mean I actually lost time, maybe?

SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_RETURN_000_CUT_010_030.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_RETURN_000_CUT_010_030.text:
Welp, no use runnin' in circles about it.
Let's get to using the power of the spirits
we gathered to fix Miyako City's barrier.

SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_RETURN_000_CUT_010_040.speaker: Komachi_Kugutu
SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_RETURN_000_CUT_010_040.text:
The barrier's heart is located
at Gokakudo Temple.

SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_RETURN_000_CUT_010_050.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_RETURN_000_CUT_010_050.text:
Makes sense, considering the temple is
smack-dab in the middle of the city.
Thanks, Komachi.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_GOKAKUDO_000_CUT_000_0.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_GOKAKUDO_000_CUT_000_0.text:
Got one shrine gate in each of the cardinal
directions, just like I expected. Guess I'll
stand in the middle while the rest'a youse
get into position, eh?

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_GOKAKUDO_000_CUT_010_0.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_GOKAKUDO_000_CUT_010_0.text:
Seems like that went pretty well.
Sky's lookin' less scary, at least.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_GOKAKUDO_000_CUT_010_0.speaker: Tomoko_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_GOKAKUDO_000_CUT_010_0.text:
The heck are you doing here, Tsuna?
Gosh, did you ditch class!?
You're dead meat if Mom finds out.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_GOKAKUDO_000_CUT_010_0.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_GOKAKUDO_000_CUT_010_0.text:
Nah, it's nothing like that, Tomoko.
I was actually just finishing up
a pretty important deal.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_GOKAKUDO_000_CUT_010_0.speaker: Tomoko_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_GOKAKUDO_000_CUT_010_0.text: Well, sure, if you say so. But if you do ever decide to ditch and just go hang, make sure to bring me along, yeah?

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_GOKAKUDO_000_CUT_010_0.speaker: Friend_Tomoko
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_GOKAKUDO_000_CUT_010_0.text:
Oh, us too! Don't forget to bring
us along, brother dearest!

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_GOKAKUDO_000_CUT_010_0.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_GOKAKUDO_000_CUT_010_0.text:
Nice to see 'em all having some fun.
Really makes a guy feel like he did
a good job protectin' the peace.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_GOKAKUDO_000_CUT_010_0.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_GOKAKUDO_000_CUT_010_0.text:
Same goes for you fellas, too.
I sure do appreciate the help.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_GOKAKUDO_000_CUT_010_1.speaker: Bou_Kugutu
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_GOKAKUDO_000_CUT_010_1.text: You ever need me, just holler.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_GOKAKUDO_000_CUT_010_1.speaker: Komachi_Kugutu
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_GOKAKUDO_000_CUT_010_1.text:
It was fun to get out and
do something for a change.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_GOKAKUDO_000_CUT_010_1.speaker: Musashi_Kugutu
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_GOKAKUDO_000_CUT_010_1.text: We are with you always, Tsunanori.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_GOKAKUDO_000_CUT_010_1.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_GOKAKUDO_000_CUT_010_1.text:
I'm thinkin' we'll all be together again
before long. Until then, take it easy.

SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_RETURN_100_CUT_000_010.speaker: Cathedral_Officer
SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_RETURN_100_CUT_000_010.text:
Wait, what? Oh, come oooooon!
I can't believe you screwed it up! Or...maybe not? Maybe time just flows
differently on the other side?

SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_RETURN_100_CUT_000_020.speaker: Cathedral_Officer
SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_RETURN_100_CUT_000_020.text: Well, let's just assume that. And in that case, I need to know everything about what lies beyond Ama-no-Iwato Cave, which means you—as well as your kugutsu and new friends—need to stick around.

SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_RETURN_100_CUT_000_030.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_RETURN_100_CUT_000_030.text:
No can do. I got important Mido family
business to take care of, so your little
investigation's gonna have to wait until
I can get that all settled.

SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_RETURN_100_CUT_000_040.speaker: Cathedral_Officer
SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_RETURN_100_CUT_000_040.text:
What? No. I can't just let you walk
out of here; I have orders directly
from Vice-Minister Mido himself.

SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_RETURN_100_CUT_000_050.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_RETURN_100_CUT_000_050.text:
Koh? Hanzo? Mind restrainin'
this nice lady for me?

SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_RETURN_100_CUT_000_060.speaker: Cathedral_Officer
SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_RETURN_100_CUT_000_060.text:
Huh!? Stop! What are you doing!?
Get your damn puppet hands off me!

SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_RETURN_100_CUT_000_070.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_RETURN_100_CUT_000_070.text:
Real sorry about this,
but I'll be back soon as I can.

SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_RETURN_100_CUT_010_000.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_RETURN_100_CUT_010_000.text:
We better shake a leg to Gokakudo Temple.
It's right in the middle of Miyako City.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_GOKAKUDO_100_CUT_000_0.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_GOKAKUDO_100_CUT_000_0.text:
Got one shrine gate in each of the cardinal
directions, just like I expected. Guess I'll
stand in the middle while the rest'a youse
get into position, eh?

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_GOKAKUDO_100_CUT_000_0.speaker: Musashi_Kugutu
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_GOKAKUDO_100_CUT_000_0.text:
Abnormality detected in the barrier
of the Azure Dragon of the East.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_GOKAKUDO_100_CUT_000_0.speaker: Komachi_Kugutu
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_GOKAKUDO_100_CUT_000_0.text:
Abnormality detected in the barrier
of the Vermillion Bird of the South.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_GOKAKUDO_100_CUT_000_0.speaker: Bou_Kugutu
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_GOKAKUDO_100_CUT_000_0.text:
Abnormality detected in the barrier
of the White Tiger of the West.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_GOKAKUDO_100_CUT_000_0.speaker: Rin_Kugutu
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_GOKAKUDO_100_CUT_000_0.text:
Abnormality detected in the barrier
of the Black Tortoise of the North.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_GOKAKUDO_100_CUT_010_0.speaker: Komachi_Kugutu
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_GOKAKUDO_100_CUT_010_0.text:
The city's barrier is bound with knots at points
relative to the location of Gokakudo Temple.
Something must be amiss at those locations.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_GOKAKUDO_100_CUT_010_0.speaker: Komachi_Kugutu
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_GOKAKUDO_100_CUT_010_0.text:
Though I fear I have no idea
where those knots might be.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_GOKAKUDO_100_CUT_010_0.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_GOKAKUDO_100_CUT_010_0.text:
You just leave that part to me.
I'll figure out where we need to go.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_SEQUOIAMALL_000_CUT_00.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_SEQUOIAMALL_000_CUT_00.text:
Sequoia Mall, eh? Wonder if the knot
that corresponds to the wood element
is around here someplace.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_SEQUOIAMALL_000_CUT_00.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_SEQUOIAMALL_000_CUT_00.text:
Don't see anything that fits the bill so far... 
Cripes almighty, am I really gonna have to
check each store one by one?

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_SEQUOIAMALL_000_CUT_00.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_SEQUOIAMALL_000_CUT_00.text:
Well, I'm not gonna find anything by
standing around. Better get after it.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_SEQUOIAMALL_000_CUT_01.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_SEQUOIAMALL_000_CUT_01.text:
Well, this is a bummer. Haven't even
been to half the stores in here yet,
and I'm already ready to call it quits.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_SEQUOIAMALL_000_CUT_01.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_SEQUOIAMALL_000_CUT_01.text:
Oh hey, Naomi. Forgot you went and
got yourself a job at the mall.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_SEQUOIAMALL_000_CUT_01.speaker: Naomi_Waka
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_SEQUOIAMALL_000_CUT_01.text:
I sure did. By the way, I had a look
at that philosophy paper you wrote.
Smart move, making it about Aristotle.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_SEQUOIAMALL_000_CUT_01.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_SEQUOIAMALL_000_CUT_01.text:
Heck, Professor Kusano's all about Aristotle.
Whenever you write a paper about the guy,
he can't help but give it a good grade.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_SEQUOIAMALL_000_CUT_01.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_SEQUOIAMALL_000_CUT_01.text:
But hey, have you seen anything here in
the mall that seems kinda...strange?
I know that's a weird question,
but I'd appreciate getting your take.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_SEQUOIAMALL_000_CUT_01.speaker: Naomi_Waka
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_SEQUOIAMALL_000_CUT_01.text:
Strange? Hmm... Well, there's an old shrine on
the roof. It was apparently here way before they
built the mall, but instead of demolishing it,
they hauled it all the way up there. Gotta say, I'm really impressed by how the
people here in Miyako City treasure all
the historic stuff they've got lying around.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_SEQUOIAMALL_000_CUT_01.speaker: Naomi_Waka
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_SEQUOIAMALL_000_CUT_01.text:
I mean, it's not like old shrines are in short supply
around here, but they kept it anyway. It stood out
to me, because I'm from one of those families
that's all about makin' way for progress.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_SEQUOIAMALL_000_CUT_01.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_SEQUOIAMALL_000_CUT_01.text:
Shoot, that's it! Thanks for the help,
Naomi—I really appreciate it. You gotta
let me return the favor sometime, yeah?

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_SEQUOIAMALL_000_CUT_01.speaker: Naomi_Waka
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_SEQUOIAMALL_000_CUT_01.text:
Oh, I should be the one thanking y—
Aaand off he goes. *sigh*
Always in a rush, that one.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_SEQUOIAMALL_000_CUT_02.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_SEQUOIAMALL_000_CUT_02.text:
Whoa, look at this! This shrine is one
of the knots, no doubt about it. Looks like they just stuck it right on top of where
it originally was, which is why the angle's all off
compared to the rest of the building.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_SEQUOIAMALL_000_CUT_02.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_SEQUOIAMALL_000_CUT_02.text:
Looks like the shrine door
was forced open.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_SEQUOIAMALL_000_CUT_02.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_SEQUOIAMALL_000_CUT_02.text:
Who the heck tore this talisman up?
I gotta put this thing back together.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_SEQUOIAMALL_000_CUT_03.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_SEQUOIAMALL_000_CUT_03.text:
Yep, that oughta do it.
I knew that wasn't just some
ordinary piece of paper.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_SEQUOIAMALL_000_CUT_03.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_SEQUOIAMALL_000_CUT_03.text:
Time to head back to
Gokakudo Temple.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_SEQUOIAMALL_000_CUT_03.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_SEQUOIAMALL_000_CUT_03.text: Better swing by the next barrier.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_SEQUOIAMALL_000_CUT_03.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_SEQUOIAMALL_000_CUT_03.text:
Cripes, I got no idea here.
Better come back another time.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_SANGENIN_000_CUT_000_0.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_SANGENIN_000_CUT_000_0.text:
Guess the knot for the water element is here
at Sangen-in Temple, maybe? This one's gonna
be a doozy; there's plenty of spots around
here where it could be hiding.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_SANGENIN_000_CUT_000_0.speaker: Tourist_Woman
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_SANGENIN_000_CUT_000_0.text:
Like, oh my GOD. I come all the way out here
and the water's not FLOWING!? Somebody needs
to fire their socials manager, like, RIGHT now,
because this was a TOTAL waste of my time!

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_SANGENIN_000_CUT_000_0.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_SANGENIN_000_CUT_000_0.text:
No water, eh? I bet that's got
something to do with the barrier.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_SANGENIN_000_CUT_010_0.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_SANGENIN_000_CUT_010_0.text:
Well, shoot. The spring's dried up.
I figure it's obvious this is the root cause,
but I have no idea how to get it back to normal.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_SANGENIN_000_CUT_010_0.speaker: Komachi_Kugutu
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_SANGENIN_000_CUT_010_0.text:
Sangen-in Temple was originally located in a
cavern within the rock. As people flocked to it
as a place of worship, a large stage with a
building was built in front of the rock. Therefore, if you wish to find the source
of the water, you must make for the inner
shrine within the cavern.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_SANGENIN_000_CUT_010_0.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_SANGENIN_000_CUT_010_0.text: Helpful info and a history lesson? See, this is why you're the best. Let's go swing by this inner shrine.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_SANGENIN_000_CUT_020_0.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_SANGENIN_000_CUT_020_0.text:
Something ain't right here, and I'm guessing
it's because some wood spirit is suckin' up
all the water. Gonna need all hands on deck
for this one, fellas!

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_SANGENIN_000_CUT_030_0.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_SANGENIN_000_CUT_030_0.text:
That's one spring fixed up good.
Hopefully we won't have any more
disappointed tourists on our hands.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_SANGENIN_000_CUT_030_0.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_SANGENIN_000_CUT_030_0.text: Time to go back to Gokakudo Temple.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_SANGENIN_000_CUT_030_0.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_SANGENIN_000_CUT_030_0.text: Better swing by the next barrier.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_ZIZOUPARK_000_CUT_000_.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_ZIZOUPARK_000_CUT_000_.text:
So this is Komainu Jizo Children's
Park, eh? Not a bad little spot.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_ZIZOUPARK_000_CUT_000_.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_ZIZOUPARK_000_CUT_000_.text:
Hey there, kiddo. You know anywhere
around here that's got a Jizo statue?

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_ZIZOUPARK_000_CUT_000_.speaker: Yumeha_Izumi
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_ZIZOUPARK_000_CUT_000_.text:
Sorry, but I just transferred here and
don't really know much about the place.
Um, but Ren might, though.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_ZIZOUPARK_000_CUT_000_.speaker: Ren_Tutuki
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_ZIZOUPARK_000_CUT_000_.text:
Say, who's the old fart
ya got there, Izumi? ...Huh? A Jizo statue? Heckin' sure
we got one of those! I mean, it's in
the name of the dang place, right?
Bring your glasses next time, gramps.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_ZIZOUPARK_000_CUT_000_.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_ZIZOUPARK_000_CUT_000_.text:
The 'gramps' thing is way outta line, guy.
How about you just tell me where I can
find this Jizo statue and spare me the lip?

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_ZIZOUPARK_000_CUT_000_.speaker: Ren_Tutuki
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_ZIZOUPARK_000_CUT_000_.text: It's back behind the swings. But watch yourself there, fella, because that Jizo statue is a monument for the aliens that came by here— and more than that, it actually is an alien!

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_ZIZOUPARK_000_CUT_000_.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_ZIZOUPARK_000_CUT_000_.text:
Thanks, guy. And, uh... I'll keep that
little alien theory of yours in mind.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_ZIZOUPARK_000_CUT_000_.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_ZIZOUPARK_000_CUT_000_.text:
Figures he'd be a bit mouthy; kid's just an
elementary schooler at the end of the day.
...Ha! Aliens. Isn't that somethin'?

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_ZIZOUPARK_000_CUT_000_.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_ZIZOUPARK_000_CUT_000_.text: Well, this is...clearly not a normal Jizo statue. Maybe it does have something to do with aliens... No, wait. If this is one of the barrier's knots, a buncha aliens aren't gonna be involved.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_ZIZOUPARK_000_CUT_000_.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_ZIZOUPARK_000_CUT_000_.text: I mean, something should be strange about the Jizo statue, but when it's this strange, it makes it hard to know where to start.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_ZIZOUPARK_000_CUT_000_.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_ZIZOUPARK_000_CUT_000_.text: Guess I'll look at it again...

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_ZIZOUPARK_000_CUT_000_.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_ZIZOUPARK_000_CUT_000_.text: Cripes, this is a waste of time.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_ZIZOUPARK_000_CUT_000_.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_ZIZOUPARK_000_CUT_000_.text:
These triangles are off. If they're s'posed to
represent how the five elements relate to each
other, it should be white, black, blue, red,
and then yellow, with none overpowerin' the other.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_ZIZOUPARK_000_CUT_010_.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_ZIZOUPARK_000_CUT_010_.text:
There we go. And heck, it looks like even
the statue's feelin' better about itself!
Weird how that works.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_ZIZOUPARK_000_CUT_010_.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_ZIZOUPARK_000_CUT_010_.text: Time to go back to Gokakudo Temple.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_ZIZOUPARK_000_CUT_010_.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_ZIZOUPARK_000_CUT_010_.text: Better swing by the next barrier.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_ZIZOUPARK_000_CUT_010_.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_ZIZOUPARK_000_CUT_010_.text:
No way I'm getting through this
without a hint. ...Hey! Ren!

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_ZIZOUPARK_000_CUT_010_.speaker: Ren_Tutuki
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_ZIZOUPARK_000_CUT_010_.text:
Isn't it about your bedtime, old timer?
...Huh? Aw geez, you got the order of
the triangles all outta whack.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_ZIZOUPARK_000_CUT_010_.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_ZIZOUPARK_000_CUT_010_.text:
That should be all the info I need
to make somethin' happen. Thanks.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_ZIZOUPARK_000_CUT_010_.speaker: Ren_Tutuki
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_ZIZOUPARK_000_CUT_010_.text:
Just watch yourself there, gramps.
Fiddle with it too much and you
might get abducted by aliens, maybe.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_RAKUSUITOWER_000_CUT_0.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_RAKUSUITOWER_000_CUT_0.text:
Rakusuiro Tower is obviously one of
the knots, but everything seems to be
just fine on the inside.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_RAKUSUITOWER_000_CUT_0.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_RAKUSUITOWER_000_CUT_0.text:
I mean, sure, havin' four floors on the inside
despite looking like five from the outside
is a bit weird, but it's always been that way.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_RAKUSUITOWER_000_CUT_0.speaker: Tomoko_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_RAKUSUITOWER_000_CUT_0.text: The heck are you doing here, Tsuna?

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_RAKUSUITOWER_000_CUT_0.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_RAKUSUITOWER_000_CUT_0.text:
Hey there, Tomoko. And heck, if it isn't
Kaoruko Hachijo! Say, this tower was built
by your family, yeah? Anything about it
seem a touch off to you lately?

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_RAKUSUITOWER_000_CUT_0.speaker: Tomoko_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_RAKUSUITOWER_000_CUT_0.text: Aw, geez! Er, well, the thing is...

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_RAKUSUITOWER_000_CUT_0.speaker: Kaoruko_Hachijo
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_RAKUSUITOWER_000_CUT_0.text:
It's okay, Tomoko—I'll tell the story.
Mind lending an ear, Tsunanori?

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_RAKUSUITOWER_000_CUT_0.speaker: Kaoruko_Hachijo
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_RAKUSUITOWER_000_CUT_0.text:
Rakusuiro Tower is a bastion of defense for
the city. My family has long said that none
of us are permitted to set foot inside,
and I've never doubted those teachings. But then, this man appeared...

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_RAKUSUITOWER_000_CUT_0.speaker: Unknown_Person
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_RAKUSUITOWER_000_CUT_0.text: Such teachings exist only to cage your soul. Should you desire to live free and true to yourself, you must enter Rakusuiro Tower. Would you deny yourself liberty?

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_RAKUSUITOWER_000_CUT_0.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_RAKUSUITOWER_000_CUT_0.text:
Cripes, Kaoruko! Never woulda thought
a smart gal like you would get played
by some sketchy weirdo.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_RAKUSUITOWER_000_CUT_0.speaker: Tomoko_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_RAKUSUITOWER_000_CUT_0.text:
Now hang on just a gosh darn minute!
It's not just Kaoruko—I was there, too! And sure, something seemed off about 
the fella from the moment he showed up,
but we still couldn't help but listen!

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_RAKUSUITOWER_000_CUT_0.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_RAKUSUITOWER_000_CUT_0.text:
I hear you. My mistake. Clearly this is all
that creeper's fault, not Kaoruko's.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_RAKUSUITOWER_000_CUT_0.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_RAKUSUITOWER_000_CUT_0.text:
Well, I took a peek inside the tower,
but everything seemed pretty normal.
What did that guy do, exactly?

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_RAKUSUITOWER_000_CUT_0.speaker: Kaoruko_Hachijo
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_RAKUSUITOWER_000_CUT_0.text:
The tower has five floors when seen
from the outside, but normally only
four can be accessed once inside. The hidden fifth floor only shows
itself to those of Hachijo blood.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_RAKUSUITOWER_000_CUT_0.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_RAKUSUITOWER_000_CUT_0.text:
Okay, now we're cookin' with gas.
So the barrier's been protected this whole
time by being kept on a hidden floor... Mind showing me that hidden floor, maybe?
I should be able to figure out what the
creeper guy did if I can get up there.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_RAKUSUITOWER_000_CUT_0.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_RAKUSUITOWER_000_CUT_0.text:
Sweet cripes, a mountain spider!
Well, now we know what the problem is:
the creeper sent this critter in here
to mess with the barrier. Sorry about this, bud. I know you're
just up here livin' your best life,
but this is the one place I can't
have you building your nest.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_RAKUSUITOWER_000_CUT_0.speaker: Kaoruko_Hachijo
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_RAKUSUITOWER_000_CUT_0.text:
I feel like you're always helping
me out in one way or another,
and I don't know how to thank you.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_RAKUSUITOWER_000_CUT_0.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_RAKUSUITOWER_000_CUT_0.text:
Just doing my duty as a part of the
Mido family. Oh, and if that creeper
ever shows his face around here again,
you just come find me, yeah?

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_RAKUSUITOWER_000_CUT_0.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_RAKUSUITOWER_000_CUT_0.text: Time to go back to Gokakudo Temple.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_RAKUSUITOWER_000_CUT_0.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_RAKUSUITOWER_000_CUT_0.text: Better swing by the next barrier.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_GOKAKUDO_BATTLE_000_CU.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_GOKAKUDO_BATTLE_000_CU.text:
So you're the one who's been going
around destroying all the knots, eh?
What's the big idea there, fella?

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_GOKAKUDO_BATTLE_000_CU.speaker: Unknown_Person
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_GOKAKUDO_BATTLE_000_CU.text:
I could ask the same; it's quite rude
of you to undo all the hard work I put
into trying to do away with them.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_GOKAKUDO_BATTLE_000_CU.speaker: Unknown_Person
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_GOKAKUDO_BATTLE_000_CU.text:
Sadly, you've left me with no choice but to
destroy Gokakudo Temple. A shame, really—
I was hoping to get through this without
attracting too much attention.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_GOKAKUDO_BATTLE_000_CU.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_GOKAKUDO_BATTLE_000_CU.text:
Destroy Gokakudo Temple? Not on my watch.
Hands off the city's cultural assets, pal!

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_GOKAKUDO_BATTLE_000_CU.speaker: Unknown_Person
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_GOKAKUDO_BATTLE_000_CU.text:
Do you truly think you've
power enough to stop me!?

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_GOKAKUDO_BATTLE_000_CU.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_GOKAKUDO_BATTLE_000_CU.text:
We're inside a barrier Gokakudo Temple created
to protect Miyako City, which means we're good
to fight our little hearts out here.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_GOKAKUDO_BATTLE_000_CU.speaker: Unknown_Person
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_GOKAKUDO_BATTLE_000_CU.text:
What foolishness! There's no way a simple
building could possess such power.
It must be a defense mechanism that was
included by whoever created the barrier. There isn't a thing about this world that
I do not find outrageously irritating!

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_GOKAKUDO_BATTLE_000_CU.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_GOKAKUDO_BATTLE_000_CU.text:
We inherited the city's barrier from
our ancestors, and I sure as heck
won't let you destroy it!

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_GOKAKUDO_BATTLE_000_CU.speaker: Unknown_Person
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_GOKAKUDO_BATTLE_000_CU.text:
This world should no longer be able to
produce people capable of protecting the
barrier... Just who are you!?

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_GOKAKUDO_BATTLE_000_CU.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_GOKAKUDO_BATTLE_000_CU.text:
The Mido family has always kept this
country safe, and it always will.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_GOKAKUDO_BATTLE_000_CU.speaker: Unknown_Person
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_GOKAKUDO_BATTLE_000_CU.text: Nonsense! All those of Mido blood perished in the war, so how can someone like you even exist?

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_GOKAKUDO_BATTLE_000_CU.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_GOKAKUDO_BATTLE_000_CU.text:
Gosh, you sure are a chatty fella, huh?
Good thing too, because I've got a whole
bunch more I wanna talk to you about.
Musashi? Sukune? Time to take this guy away.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_GOKAKUDO_BATTLE_000_CU.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_GOKAKUDO_BATTLE_000_CU.text:
Cripes! Did he blow himself up?
...Nah. Probably just vanished.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_GOKAKUDO_BATTLE_000_CU.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_GOKAKUDO_BATTLE_000_CU.text:
Well, curious as I am about his deal,
I better get the barrier fixed up first.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_SEIDO_LAST_000_CUT_000.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_SEIDO_LAST_000_CUT_000.text:
I couldn't have protected the barrier
without everyone's help, so thanks.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_SEIDO_LAST_000_CUT_000.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_SEIDO_LAST_000_CUT_000.text:
Ah, right, forgot about you. My bad.
Anyway, I'm all done here. Later.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_SEIDO_LAST_000_CUT_000.speaker: Cathedral_Officer
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_SEIDO_LAST_000_CUT_000.text:
Do you think some whimsical apology is enough
to get you off the hook? Need I remind you
that the point of this entire project is to—

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_SEIDO_LAST_000_CUT_000.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_SEIDO_LAST_000_CUT_000.text:
Gonna have to stop you right there. I think it's time I had a
long talk with my uncle, the Vice-Minister of Domestic Affairs.
We'll need more long-term initiatives in place if we want to
protect Miyako City, this country, and the entire world.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_SEIDO_LAST_000_CUT_000.speaker: Cathedral_Officer
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_SEIDO_LAST_000_CUT_000.text:
You...seem serious. Still, I have questions
of my own, and I won't let you weasel your
way out of giving me some answers.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_SEIDO_LAST_000_CUT_000.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_SEIDO_LAST_000_CUT_000.text: Do you want me to sic Koh and Hanzo on you again?

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_SEIDO_LAST_000_CUT_000.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_SEIDO_LAST_000_CUT_000.text:
Then I'll just be on my merry way, eh?
Heck, if I don't get my buns home soon,
Mother'll never let me hear the end of it.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_SEIDO_LAST_000_CUT_010.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_SEIDO_LAST_000_CUT_010.text: Hey there, Dad! When'd you get back?

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_SEIDO_LAST_000_CUT_010.speaker: Masatsuna_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_SEIDO_LAST_000_CUT_010.text:
Plane just landed—had myself a bit of
a bumpy flight. Seems like everything
worked out just fine over here, though.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_SEIDO_LAST_000_CUT_010.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_SEIDO_LAST_000_CUT_010.text:
Yeah, not too shabby, if you ask me.
No way I coulda pulled it off without
you and Mother in my corner, though.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_SEIDO_LAST_000_CUT_010.speaker: Masatsuna_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_SEIDO_LAST_000_CUT_010.text:
Still... Maybe it's best we keep this
whole mess a secret from your mom.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_SEIDO_LAST_000_CUT_010.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_SEIDO_LAST_000_CUT_010.text:
Hear you loud and clear. Heck, I know
anything to do with Uncle Tadamichi
is a bit of a sore spot.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_SEIDO_LAST_000_CUT_010.speaker: Masatsuna_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_SEIDO_LAST_000_CUT_010.text:
Ha ha ha! It is indeed.
Now let's get home, Son.

SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_RETURN_200_CUT_000_000.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_RETURN_200_CUT_000_000.text:
Tsunanori Mido here.
I'm back from the other side.

SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_RETURN_200_CUT_010_000.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_RETURN_200_CUT_010_000.text:
The heck's going on here?
Why does everything feel so...off?

SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_RETURN_200_CUT_010_010.speaker: Musashi_Kugutu
SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_RETURN_200_CUT_010_010.text:
Evil spirits are roaming about
unchecked. It's likely the barrier
has been destroyed.

SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_RETURN_200_CUT_010_030.speaker: Komachi_Kugutu
SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_RETURN_200_CUT_010_030.text:
The heart of the barrier is
located at Gokakudo Temple.
Let's make our way there for now.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_GOKAKUDO_200_CUT_000_0.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_GOKAKUDO_200_CUT_000_0.text:
Thank cripes Gokakudo Temple
seems to be okay.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_GOKAKUDO_200_CUT_000_0.speaker: Komachi_Kugutu
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_GOKAKUDO_200_CUT_000_0.text:
Then let us make all haste and instill
the power of the spirits here, for the
barrier cannot be made whole once more
without the divine force of the four gods.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_GOKAKUDO_200_CUT_000_0.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_GOKAKUDO_200_CUT_000_0.text:
Seems like Gokakudo Temple's been filled
up with plenty of power, but...am I really
gonna be able to put the barrier back up
all on my lonesome?

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_GOKAKUDO_200_CUT_000_0.speaker: Musashi_Kugutu
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_GOKAKUDO_200_CUT_000_0.text:
You have us at your side, Tsunanori.
You must believe in yourself.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_GOKAKUDO_200_CUT_000_0.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_GOKAKUDO_200_CUT_000_0.text:
Thanks, Musashi. Welp, let's get to it.
Which direction should we start with?

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_KEKKAI_200_CUT_000_000.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_KEKKAI_200_CUT_000_000.text:
This evil spirit is what went and destroyed
the barrier, so I guess we'd better start
by getting it out of the picture.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_KEKKAI_200_CUT_010_010.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_KEKKAI_200_CUT_010_010.text: Wait, so the power of the spirits forced that evil spirit into submission? Oh heck, I get it now! That evil spirit didn't destroy the barrier, it forms the barrier! Man, that's wild. Whoever went and made this thing is a certified genius.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_KEKKAI_200_CUT_010_020.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_KEKKAI_200_CUT_010_020.text:
In any case, that's the first barrier fixed up
real nice, which means I've got three to go.
I can already tell this is gonna be tough.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_KEKKAI_210_CUT_000_000.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_KEKKAI_210_CUT_000_000.text:
This evil spirit and the one at the
last place both seem kinda familiar...

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_KEKKAI_210_CUT_010_000.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_KEKKAI_210_CUT_010_000.text:
Uh, did I see that guy
at the last place, maybe?

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_KEKKAI_210_CUT_010_010.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_KEKKAI_210_CUT_010_010.text:
Well, whatever.
Two down, two to go.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_KEKKAI_220_CUT_000_000.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_KEKKAI_220_CUT_000_000.text: Yep, these are definitely the same evil spirits I ran into before going through the doors to the worlds I visited. But what the heck does it all mean?

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_KEKKAI_220_CUT_000_010.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_KEKKAI_220_CUT_000_010.text:
Oh swell, that guy again. He's gotta be
the one destroying all the barriers.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_KEKKAI_220_CUT_010_000.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_KEKKAI_220_CUT_010_000.text:
So all the evil spirits bound to the barrier
were beings from the Conjoined Worlds?
Boy, that is a thing right there. I thought Miyako City was isolated from
other worlds, but I guess it's always been
more closely connected than I thought.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_KEKKAI_220_CUT_010_010.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_KEKKAI_220_CUT_010_010.text:
More importantly, who the heck is that guy
I keep seeing, and why does he keep comin'
back to the scene of the crime? Feels like
I'm in a crummy mystery novel here.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_KEKKAI_230_CUT_000_000.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_KEKKAI_230_CUT_000_000.text:
All right, I know you're there, guy!
Quit hiding and show yourself!

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_KEKKAI_230_CUT_000_010.speaker: Musashi_Kugutu
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_KEKKAI_230_CUT_000_010.text: Focus on the battle at hand, Tsunanori!

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_KEKKAI_230_CUT_010_000.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_KEKKAI_230_CUT_010_000.text: I knew that guy was watchin' me! Hey! Hold up a minute, fella!

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_KEKKAI_230_CUT_010_040.speaker: Tadako_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_KEKKAI_230_CUT_010_040.text: The barrier has been made anew.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_KEKKAI_230_CUT_010_050.speaker: Masatsuna_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_KEKKAI_230_CUT_010_050.text:
And the evil spirits
are disappearing.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_KEKKAI_230_CUT_010_060.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_KEKKAI_230_CUT_010_060.text:
Well, would you look at that?
I guess I did it.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_KEKKAI_230_CUT_010_080.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_KEKKAI_230_CUT_010_080.text: A compliment? From you, Mother? Ha ha ha! Think this is the first time you've ever said something like that!

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_KEKKAI_230_CUT_010_090.speaker: Tadako_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_KEKKAI_230_CUT_010_090.text:
Don't be silly. I'm certain I've praised
you many times before.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_KEKKAI_230_CUT_010_100.speaker: Masatsuna_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_KEKKAI_230_CUT_010_100.text:
Anyhoo, let's get you home, Son.
You deserve some rest, eh?

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_KEKKAI_230_CUT_010_110.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_KEKKAI_230_CUT_010_110.text:
No can do—not yet, anyway. I need to track
down that guy from before and find out
why he destroyed the barrier, or the same
thing'll just happen all over again.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_KEKKAI_230_CUT_010_120.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_KEKKAI_230_CUT_010_120.text:
Look out—he's heading to the shrine.
Must be planning to escape to the Heavens!

SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_RETURN_210_CUT_000_000.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_RETURN_210_CUT_000_000.text:
We got folks out there trying to change our
world for good, and no way of knowing when
or where they'll strike. Keeping everything
we care about safe is gonna be...tough.

SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_RETURN_210_CUT_000_010.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_RETURN_210_CUT_000_010.text:
But you know what? That's fine.
Got my mind all made up.

SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_RETURN_210_CUT_000_020.speaker: Cathedral_Officer
SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_RETURN_210_CUT_000_020.text:
Tsunanori Mido!
When did you get back?

SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_RETURN_210_CUT_000_030.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_RETURN_210_CUT_000_030.text:
Heck, I could ask you the same question.
Where'd you get off to, anyway?

SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_RETURN_210_CUT_000_040.speaker: Cathedral_Officer
SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_RETURN_210_CUT_000_040.text:
When you crossed to the other side of the stone,
the way you disappeared left me with a horrible sense
of unease. Did you really head into the Heavens,
or was it some kind of weird illusion? The whole thing
had me so shook that I just sort of...ran away.

SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_RETURN_210_CUT_000_050.speaker: Cathedral_Officer
SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_RETURN_210_CUT_000_050.text:
I'm not sure why I left; abandoning my post in a panic
isn't really my thing. Anyway, once I managed to pull
myself together, I came right back. Though I'm not
really sure why I did that, either...

SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_RETURN_210_CUT_000_060.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_RETURN_210_CUT_000_060.text:
Yeah, the city's barrier was busted for a
bit there, which is why everybody felt wonky.
Unease is contagious, you know—and it just
gets bigger and uglier as it spreads.

SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_RETURN_210_CUT_000_070.speaker: Cathedral_Officer
SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_RETURN_210_CUT_000_070.text:
And...what? You, a boy of the esteemed
Mido family, sorted it all out and put
everything to rights? You think you're
some kind of superhero or something?

SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_RETURN_210_CUT_000_080.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_RETURN_210_CUT_000_080.text:
Nah, nothing like that. All I did was repair
the barrier and protect what I thought needed
protecting. And you can believe that or not—
no skin off my tush either way.

SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_RETURN_210_CUT_000_090.speaker: Cathedral_Officer
SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_RETURN_210_CUT_000_090.text:
...You certainly are a very
interesting man, Tsunanori.

SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_RETURN_210_CUT_010_020.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_RETURN_210_CUT_010_020.text:
Mother? Dad? Thank you for everything you've done
in raising me. I appreciate it more than you'll
ever know, and I'm real sorry I've gone all this
time without telling you.

SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_RETURN_210_CUT_010_030.speaker: Masatsuna_Mido
SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_RETURN_210_CUT_010_030.text:
Whoa there, kiddo!
Where's this coming from?

SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_RETURN_210_CUT_010_040.speaker: Tadako_Mido
SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_RETURN_210_CUT_010_040.text:
Oh, Tsunanori... *sniff* If anyone
is owed gratitude here, it's you.
Isn't that right, dear?

SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_RETURN_210_CUT_010_050.speaker: Tomoko_Mido
SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_RETURN_210_CUT_010_050.text:
Tsuna? Why is Mother crying?
The heck did you do to her!?

SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_RETURN_210_CUT_010_060.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_RETURN_210_CUT_010_060.text: Tomoko! Thank you so, so much for being my little sis.

SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_RETURN_210_CUT_010_070.speaker: Tomoko_Mido
SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_RETURN_210_CUT_010_070.text: Okay geez, what is up with you!? I don't care if you're my brother— this is super embarrassing!

SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_RETURN_210_CUT_010_080.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_RETURN_210_CUT_010_080.text:
I'm the happiest guy in the world... But you know what?
Happiness is somethin' that needs protecting, and the
only reason we're here now is because all sorts of folks
did what they could to protect this city and our country.

SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_RETURN_210_CUT_010_090.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_RETURN_210_CUT_010_090.text:
As a proud member of the Mido family,
I'll do all I can to keep Miyako City safe.

SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_RETURN_220_CUT_000_000.speaker: Cathedral_Officer
SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_RETURN_220_CUT_000_000.text:
There you are, Tsunanori Mido!
Were you off in the Heavens again?

SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_RETURN_220_CUT_000_020.speaker: Cathedral_Officer
SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_RETURN_220_CUT_000_020.text: Wow, okay. What was that about? He seemed like a totally different person.

SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_RETURN_220_CUT_010_020.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_RETURN_220_CUT_010_020.text:
The one you know as Tsunanori is no more.
Led astray by your deception and forced to
bear the curse of the Mido name, he lost
sight of his true self—so I erased him.

SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_RETURN_220_CUT_010_040.speaker: Tadako_Mido
SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_RETURN_220_CUT_010_040.text: ...So you learned the truth, did you? Well, that doesn't change the fact that you are Tsunanori Mido.

SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_RETURN_220_CUT_010_050.speaker: Tomoko_Mido
SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_RETURN_220_CUT_010_050.text:
Tsuna? Why is Mother crying?
The heck did you do to her!?

SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_RETURN_220_CUT_010_060.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_RETURN_220_CUT_010_060.text:
Did you know you have no brother, Tomoko?
To think of all the time you wasted admiring
someone who was a perfect stranger...
What a sad, pathetic girl you are.

SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_RETURN_220_CUT_010_070.speaker: Tomoko_Mido
SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_RETURN_220_CUT_010_070.text: Wh-what? Tsuna, why would you say something like that!?

SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_RETURN_220_CUT_010_080.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_RETURN_220_CUT_010_080.text:
I did not come here to reproach you.
All you need know is this:
the Tsunanori you knew is dead.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_GOKAKUDO_220_CUT_000_0.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_GOKAKUDO_220_CUT_000_0.text:
This is the heart of the barrier. Should it be undone,
this world will be unleashed in the direction of the
Conjoined Worlds, and I will be freed from my fate.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_GOKAKUDO_220_CUT_000_0.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_GOKAKUDO_220_CUT_000_0.text:
It's done... I have done it! Now this world
can become one with the Conjoined Worlds!
I have finally accomplished the task I was
born into this land to achieve!

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_GOKAKUDO_220_CUT_000_0.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_GOKAKUDO_220_CUT_000_0.text: The sham of a life I led as Tsunanori Mido is over. Farewell, my false family. Farewell, my false home. I have been freed from all that kept me bound... and I am reborn!

SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_RETURN_300_CUT_000_010.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_RETURN_300_CUT_000_010.text:
What in the heck happened
here while I was gone?

SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_RETURN_300_CUT_010_000.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_RETURN_300_CUT_010_000.text:
The barrier's been destroyed...
I'm too late.

SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_RETURN_300_CUT_010_010.speaker: Unknown_Person
SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_RETURN_300_CUT_010_010.text:
Just what were you doing gallivanting
about the Conjoined Worlds? You were
sent to this world to protect it, you fool!
...No. This is all wrong.

SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_RETURN_300_CUT_010_020.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_RETURN_300_CUT_010_020.text: Huh? Wait, what's wrong? What do you mean, I was sent here? Did you seriously expect me to follow any of that malarkey?

SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_RETURN_300_CUT_010_030.speaker: Unknown_Person
SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_RETURN_300_CUT_010_030.text:
If you truly wish to learn, it's better you
hear it from the lips of those closest to you
rather than myself. That is the only way
this wrong might be set to rights.

SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_RETURN_300_CUT_010_040.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_RETURN_300_CUT_010_040.text:
Is saying stuff in roundabout ways just
your thing, guy? Who are you, anyway?

SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_RETURN_300_CUT_010_050.speaker: Unknown_Person
SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_RETURN_300_CUT_010_050.text:
I'd be more than happy to tell you...
after you learn all you must know.

SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_RETURN_300_CUT_010_060.speaker: Unknown_Person
SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_RETURN_300_CUT_010_060.text:
This world has been invaded
by beings of destruction from
the Conjoined Worlds that seek
to tear down all which is good. Should they learn you have returned,
they will attempt to destroy you as well.
Hear me well, then: be careful.

SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_RETURN_300_CUT_010_070.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_WRLD_MIDO_RETURN_300_CUT_010_070.text: Well, that fella's sketchy as all heck. Hope he didn't expect I'd believe all the junk he was spewing there. That said, the shrine has been destroyed— and I'm also sorta curious about the part regarding the people close to me...

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_RAKUGAKU_300_CUT_000_0.speaker: Kaoruko_Hachijo
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_RAKUGAKU_300_CUT_000_0.text:
Tsunanori! Thank goodness you're here!
Tomoko's been abducted!

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_RAKUGAKU_300_CUT_000_0.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_RAKUGAKU_300_CUT_000_0.text: Now hold on just a second there! Someone took my sister?

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_RAKUGAKU_300_CUT_000_0.speaker: Kaoruko_Hachijo
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_RAKUGAKU_300_CUT_000_0.text:
It's all a bit strange, but it seemed
like no one else could see it happen?
That makes me think it must have been
some manner of evil spirit.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_RAKUGAKU_300_CUT_000_0.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_RAKUGAKU_300_CUT_000_0.text:
Appreciate the heads-up. Also, the barrier's
been broken and evil spirits are struttin'
around like they own the place, so go find
somewhere safe. I'll get Tomoko back myself.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_RAKUGAKU_300_CUT_000_0.speaker: Kaoruko_Hachijo
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_RAKUGAKU_300_CUT_000_0.text:
Do be careful, Tsunanori. The city is
filled with energies most malevolent.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_OOIKE_300_CUT_000_000.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_OOIKE_300_CUT_000_000.text:
This energy... You're not one of the spirits that
inhabit Miyako City, which means you gotta be a 
being of destruction from the Conjoined Worlds!
What the heck are you doin' with Tomoko!?

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_OOIKE_300_CUT_000_020.speaker: Tomoko_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_OOIKE_300_CUT_000_020.text:
Eeek! Wait, stop! Don't kill me!
I got nothing to do with this!

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_OOIKE_300_CUT_000_040.speaker: Tomoko_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_OOIKE_300_CUT_000_040.text: Stay back! All this weird stuff keeps happening to me because you're around, and I'm super sick of it! I mean, I can deal with stuff like snakes and poisonous bugs and whatever, but almost getting killed by monsters is where I draw the freakin' line!

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_OOIKE_300_CUT_000_050.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_OOIKE_300_CUT_000_050.text:
That monster was after me, and...
I'm real sorry you got caught up in this.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_OOIKE_300_CUT_000_060.speaker: Tomoko_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_OOIKE_300_CUT_000_060.text: You're sorry? You're sorry? I've been getting caught up in stupid junk like this since the day I was born. Ugh, why did I have to be your little sister? I'm so sick of pretending to be a Mido. I just wanna live a normal life.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_OOIKE_300_CUT_000_070.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_OOIKE_300_CUT_000_070.text:
Pretending to be...
Wait, what do you mean?

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_OOIKE_300_CUT_000_080.speaker: Tomoko_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_OOIKE_300_CUT_000_080.text:
There is no 'Tomoko Mido,' you big doof!
There's also no 'Dad,' and no 'Mother.'
We're all a bunch of fakes that've been
set up to pass you off as 'Tsunanori Mido.'

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_OOIKE_300_CUT_000_090.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_OOIKE_300_CUT_000_090.text: What? No. That can't be true...

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_OOIKE_300_CUT_000_100.speaker: Tomoko_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_OOIKE_300_CUT_000_100.text: I used to think how nice it'd be if you really were my brother, but nope! I'm done with all of it, mister! DONE!

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_OOIKE_300_CUT_000_120.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_OOIKE_300_CUT_000_120.text: Tomoko... Tell me it isn't true...

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_OOIKE_300_CUT_000_130.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_OOIKE_300_CUT_000_130.text: Tomoko... So that's how it is...

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_HOME_300_CUT_000_000.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_HOME_300_CUT_000_000.text:
Dad... Mother...
Is what Tomoko said really true?

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_HOME_300_CUT_000_030.speaker: SP
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_HOME_300_CUT_000_030.text:
...Tsunanori Mido has arrived
on the scene. Over.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_HOME_300_CUT_000_040.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_HOME_300_CUT_000_040.text:
Why won't you let me in?
This is my home!

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_HOME_300_CUT_000_050.speaker: SP
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_HOME_300_CUT_000_050.text:
Not anymore it isn't.
You're coming with me,
Tsunanori Mido.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_HOME_300_CUT_000_090.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_HOME_300_CUT_000_090.text:
What're you still doing here!?
Get outta my way!

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_STATION_300_CUT_000_01.speaker: Masatsuna_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_STATION_300_CUT_000_01.text:
I'm not your dad anymore, kiddo—I'm done
playing Masatsuna Mido. From now on,
I'm just a regular old man. Got a call from Vice-Minister Mido in
Domestic Affairs sayin' the whole thing's off,
and... Well, that's really all there is to it.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_STATION_300_CUT_000_02.speaker: Masatsuna_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_STATION_300_CUT_000_02.text:
Still, we were together so long, I really
started thinking of you as my own son.
So take care of yourself, kiddo.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_STATION_300_CUT_000_03.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_STATION_300_CUT_000_03.text:
What the heck? Wait, that's it?
That's all you have to say to me?

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_MALL_300_CUT_000_010.speaker: Tadako_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_MALL_300_CUT_000_010.text:
Goodness! Found me, have you? Well, I guess I
should start by apologizing for being so darn
strict with you all these years—that's just
how I was asked to play the role. I admit it was nice being able to wear such
fancy clothes all the time. But now I'll just
be a normal woman who does normal things
like... Oh, you know, shop at the mall.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_MALL_300_CUT_000_020.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_MALL_300_CUT_000_020.text:
Tell me this is all some kinda joke!
You're all working together to pull
some kinda prank on me, right?

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_MALL_300_CUT_000_030.speaker: Tadako_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_MALL_300_CUT_000_030.text:
If you got questions, hon, you should be asking
Vice-Minister Mido, not me. He's the one who
found you at Ama-no-Iwato, and also the one
who asked us to raise you as Tsunanori Mido.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_MALL_300_CUT_000_040.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_MALL_300_CUT_000_040.text:
I don't imagine we'll meet again.
Be well, Tsunanori.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_MALL_300_CUT_000_050.speaker: Tadako_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_MALL_300_CUT_000_050.text:
How can you say goodbye so easily?
How can you lose your family and
just...be okay with it?

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_SEIDO_300_CUT_000_000.speaker: Unknown_Person
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_SEIDO_300_CUT_000_000.text: Ah. I see you've learned the truth.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_SEIDO_300_CUT_000_010.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_SEIDO_300_CUT_000_010.text:
Always knew I was a weird sorta kid,
but I never would've guessed my entire
family was completely made up.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_SEIDO_300_CUT_000_020.speaker: Unknown_Person
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_SEIDO_300_CUT_000_020.text:
I must say, I'm relieved to see you're
managing to process this entire
revelation with relative composure.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_SEIDO_300_CUT_000_040.speaker: Unknown_Person
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_SEIDO_300_CUT_000_040.text:
Then let us fill the newly carved hollow in
your heart with the mission you were meant
to carry out. You are to protect this world
from beings who would see it destroyed. Their aim is to destroy what makes each world
pure and unique, and in so doing reduce the
Conjoined Worlds to a single, solitary existence.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_SEIDO_300_CUT_000_050.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_SEIDO_300_CUT_000_050.text:
So I guess Miyako City's barrier is meant
to protect us from those bad guys?
Suppose that explains why we've been doing
all this for over a thousand years...

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_SEIDO_300_CUT_000_060.speaker: Unknown_Person
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_SEIDO_300_CUT_000_060.text:
But this time we failed—and should the
world be lost, it can never be reclaimed. This is a problem which must be torn out by
the very roots. We must destroy the gateway
that leads to the Conjoined Worlds.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_SEIDO_300_CUT_000_070.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_SEIDO_300_CUT_000_070.text: You want to destroy the Ama-no-Iwato?

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_SEIDO_300_CUT_000_080.speaker: Unknown_Person
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_SEIDO_300_CUT_000_080.text:
I do. Should we see it through,
this world will be permanently
detached from the Conjoined Worlds. Freed from the taint of outside influences,
it will be permitted to retain its
purity and individuality...forever.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_SEIDO_300_CUT_000_100.speaker: Unknown_Person
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_SEIDO_300_CUT_000_100.text:
Then I shall withdraw and leave the rest to you.
And while we will never again cross paths,
I hope you find happiness here. Farewell.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_SEIDO_300_CUT_000_110.speaker: Musashi_Kugutu
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_SEIDO_300_CUT_000_110.text:
What do you intend to do with the
spirits we've gathered, Tsunanori?

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_SEIDO_300_CUT_000_120.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_SEIDO_300_CUT_000_120.text: Hey there, guy. So, uh, turns out I'm not actually Tsunanori Mido. Don't really know who the heck I am, honestly.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_SEIDO_300_CUT_000_130.speaker: Musashi_Kugutu
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_SEIDO_300_CUT_000_130.text: We all recognize the life force that courses through you to be that of Tsunanori Mido. Therefore, you are Tsunanori Mido.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_SEIDO_300_CUT_000_140.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_SEIDO_300_CUT_000_140.text:
I appreciate it, bud. In that case,
guess I'll keep goin' by Tsunanori Mido,
since you insist and all. Anyway, let's get to fixin' up the barrier,
yeah? Everything else can wait until that
little project is done.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_GOKAKUDO_300_CUT_000_0.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_GOKAKUDO_300_CUT_000_0.text:
We'll get all sorts of bad characters in Miyako City
if the barrier's busted, so I figure this'll help everyone
pull themselves together. ...My family too, hopefully.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_CATHEDRAL_300_CUT_000_.speaker: Musashi_Kugutu
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_CATHEDRAL_300_CUT_000_.text:
Do you truly intend to
destroy the stone?

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_CATHEDRAL_300_CUT_000_.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_CATHEDRAL_300_CUT_000_.text:
Yeah, I dunno. Maybe I should talk to
my uncle... Er, to Tadamichi Mido first.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_CATHEDRAL_300_CUT_000_.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_CATHEDRAL_300_CUT_000_.text:
...Nah, he's got nothin' to do with this.
Every decision I've made up to this point
is one I made on my own.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_CATHEDRAL_300_CUT_000_.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_CATHEDRAL_300_CUT_000_.text: All sorts of stuff happened because I passed through the stone and into the Heavens... So is closing that path for good really the right thing to do?

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_CATHEDRAL_300_CUT_000_.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_CATHEDRAL_300_CUT_000_.text: The stone's not the problem here.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_CATHEDRAL_300_CUT_000_.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_CATHEDRAL_300_CUT_000_.text:
There are folks in the Heavens who wanna use me—
and because of that, everyone I care about had
their lives turned completely upside-down.
That's the reason everything's gone to heck.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_CATHEDRAL_300_CUT_000_.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_CATHEDRAL_300_CUT_000_.text:
I need to know what the big idea
was in doing all of this junk!
My life belongs to me, dangit!

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_END_300_CUT_000_030.speaker: Masatsuna_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_END_300_CUT_000_030.text:
Are you sure this was
for the best, Son?

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_END_300_CUT_000_040.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_END_300_CUT_000_040.text: You betcha. Heck, you guys are the only family I'd ever want. ...Though I suppose I am a bit worried about Mother.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_END_300_CUT_000_050.speaker: Tadako_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_END_300_CUT_000_050.text:
I'm a bit worried about me too, hon.
After twenty years of the high life,
I'm not sure I'll be able to go back
to being a plain old Jane.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_END_300_CUT_000_060.speaker: Tomoko_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_END_300_CUT_000_060.text:
Well, I get to live with Tsuna and Dad and Mother
again, so I think it's great! It's a bummer I can't see
my friends from school anymore, but I bet I'll make
new ones here in Hokkaijima.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_END_300_CUT_000_070.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_END_300_CUT_000_070.text:
Sorry you guys had to suffer
through all that because of me.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_END_300_CUT_000_080.speaker: Masatsuna_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_END_300_CUT_000_080.text:
I'd better not hear you say that again, Son.
You did what you had to do, we were there for you,
and that's all there is to it. Now c'mon. Let's all work
together to make a fresh start here in Hokkaijima.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_END_300_CUT_000_090.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_END_300_CUT_000_090.text:
You know? I may not be able to see
the Emerald Wave anymore...

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_END_300_CUT_000_100.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_END_300_CUT_000_100.text:
But I somehow feel more connected
to all of you than ever.

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_RAKUHOKUSTA_PATH_000_C.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_RAKUHOKUSTA_PATH_000_C.text:
Rakuto Station is close to Sequoia Mall,
and Rakunan Station is close to Keihoku
Elementary School. Which should I swing by?

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_RAKUNANSTA_PATH_000_CU.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_RAKUNANSTA_PATH_000_CU.text:
Rakuhoku Station is close to Miyako Imperial
University, and Rakuto Station is close to
Sequoia Mall. Which should I swing by?

SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_RAKUTOSTA_PATH_000_CUT.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W01_EVAR_MIDO_RAKUTOSTA_PATH_000_CUT.text:
Rakuhoku Station is close to Miyako Imperial
University, and Rakunan Station is close to Keihoku
Elementary School. Which should I swing by?
